identificationModule.briefTitle: Fasting Mimicking Diet in Chemotherapy of Gynecologic Malignancies
identificationModule.officialTitle: Use of a Fasting Mimicking Diet in Patients Undergoing Chemotherapy for Gynecologic Malignancies

descriptionModule.briefSummary: This study evaluates how lifestyle modifications that may be made to manage chemotherapy side effects in patients with gynecologic malignancies.
descriptionModule.detailedDescription: Since chemotherapy remains one of the primary treatment modalities for gynecologic malignancies, there is increasing interest in non-pharmacological methods of reducing chemotherapy side effects in cancer patients. Our goal is to increase the knowledge surrounding lifestyle modifications, specifically the fasting mimicking diet, on chemotherapy-related side effects, which may be more acceptable to patients than a previously studied water-only fasting diet. To expand this knowledge, The investigators will focus on patients undergoing chemotherapy for gynecologic malignancies. These patients will be assigned to no dietary restriction (control group) or a 5-day fasting mimicking diet (FMD by L-Nutra) for three days prior to, the day of, and one day following chemotherapy treatments (treatment group). The investigators aim to evaluate the feasibility of a fasting mimicking diet in addition to its metabolic effects on the body, patient reported side effects, patient quality of life, deviations or delays in treatment plans, and hospital admissions. Our hypothesis is that a fasting mimicking diet will significantly decrease chemotherapy-related side effects while providing good quality of life.

armGroups.label: FMD
armGroups.description: In addition to the standard care, subject will consume a 5-day fasting mimicking diet.

armGroups.label: Control
armGroups.description: Subjects will receive the standard care and no dietary changes.

interventions.name: Fasting Mimicking Diet
interventions.description: Subject will consume 6 cycles of 5-day fasting mimicking diet: 3 days prior to, the day of, and 1 day following chemotherapy treatments.

interventions.name: Chemotherapy
interventions.description: 6 cycles of standard chemotherapy for the gynecologic malignancy.

primaryOutcomes.measure: Quality of life by National Comprehensive Cancer Network-Functional Assessment of Cancer Therapy Ovarian Cancer Symptom Index (NFOSI-18) questionnaire
primaryOutcomes.description: The NFOSI-18 questionnaire allows for a uniform assessment of health-related quality of life through an 18-question (5-point Likert-type scale) survey including four subscale domains: Disease-Related Symptoms - Physical, Disease-Related Symptoms - Emotional, Treatment Side Effects. and Function/Well-Being. To calculate subscale scores, sum the item scores within each domain. Higher subscale scores indicate more significant symptom burden or impact. The total score is obtained by summing all 18 item scores. A higher total score reflects more severe symptoms overall.
The ability to adhere to a 5-day fasting mimicking diet.

secondaryOutcomes.description: Changes in weight, skeletal muscle mass, body fat percentage by the Inbody(R) Body Composition Analyzer.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Change in Insulin Like Growth Factor 1 (IGF-1) Concentration
secondaryOutcomes.description: Change in blood insulin like growth factor 1 level.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Change in High-sensitivity C reactive protein Concentration
secondaryOutcomes.description: Change in blood C reactive protein level.
Deviation from the planned chemotherapy regimen.
Rate of Adverse effects associated with chemotherapy

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Women
* Age 35-70 years old (both inclusive)
* Biopsy proven gynecologic malignancy
* Scheduled to or currently undergoing chemotherapy, with a minimum of 6 cycles remaining
* BMI greater than or equal to 18.5
* Adequate renal function (serum creatinine less than 1.5 times the upper limit of normal)
* Willing to adhere to a 5-day fasting mimicking diet

Exclusion Criteria:

* Pregnant or nursing mothers
* Prisoners
* Patients with diabetes or history of hypoglycemia
* Taking daily medications that cannot be safely taken without food
* History of significant or unstable cardiac disease such as congestive heart failure or history of myocardial infarction, stroke or pulmonary embolism within the last 3 months, renal failure, history of - eating disorder, dementia, psychosis, impaired physical mobility.
* Significant medical comorbidity that would be dangerous with a fasting mimicking diet.
* Any known or suspected food allergies that overlap with the FMD/Transitional diet by L-Nutra meal kit ingredients.
eligibilityModule.genderDescription: The study focuses on the chemotherapy of gynecologic malignancies.
